I say do a combination - pursue your passion absolutely, but have a fallback plan.

You want to be a writer?

I think of Sadie Tanner Mozell Alexander, who was the first black woman to get a PhD in economics.

She was not able to find a job pursuing her passion, and so she ended up going back to get a law degree.
And she contributed mightily to the study of law and mightily to her sorority and mine, Delta Sigma Theta, mightily to many things.
She didn't get her first choice, but she got another choice.
So I always tell people, look at your many choices.
Don't close any doors.

So who are your allies in trying to make sure that young people have a place to go?
